Announcing the SPARK Mission High School teacher grant program

Teachers are the nucleus of the Mission High School student experience. To demonstrate the foundation's appreciation of and commitment to teachers, the foundation's first grant program is designed to directly support teacher creativity, innovation, empathy and hard work.

The SPARK teacher grants

Via the SPARK grants program, the Mission High Foundation will be awarding Mission High teachers a total of $10,000 to prototype, launch and/or grow innovative programs. The funds will be awarded as follows:

1 $5000 grant

2 $1000 grants

6 $500 grants

Teachers can begin submitting applications on the Mission High Foundation website beginning Monday August 24th at 12noon PT. Teachers are encouraged to submit their grant applications before the end of August. Grants will be awarded on a rolling basis and MHF is looking to put the funds to work as soon as possible to maximize student impact within the 2015/2016 school year. Teachers are also encouraged submit multiple applications at all grant levels, but for the Fall 2015 SPARK grants the foundation will only award one grant per teacher.

Teachers are also encouraged to submit multiple applications at any and/or all grant levels. Multiple applications may increase your chances of winning grant perhaps more importantly it informs MHF how many latent program ideas are 'in house' on the shelf waiting to be funded. For the Fall 2015 SPARK grants, the foundation will only award one grant per teacher.

SPARK Grant Criteria: Fall 2015

Alignment with MHS balanced scorecard goals

Alignment with SFUSD Vision 2025

Innovative project based blended discipline programs

Equity centered programs
